main.bio:
Abhishek is a graduate researcher at Systems Software Research Group, Virginia Tech. He is mainly interested in systems software and has worked in the areas of cross architecture application state transformation, libraryOS, Compilers, OS security and Virtualization. 
Having worked as a software engineer for almost 3 years, Abhishek writes optimized, clean, modular, maintainable and testable code. 
In his spare cycles, Abhishek likes to indulge in prog music, playing chess and reading. 
Feel free to reach out to him on his email id or the linked social media handles.

resume.skillmessage: The following are the skills Abhishek has gained proficiency in.

work.company: Systems Software Research Group, Virginia Tech
work.title: Graduate Research Assistant
work.description:
• Currently working on extending the checkpoint-restore functionality for the Linux kernel to provide heterogeneous ISA support. 
• Implemented the multiboot2 protocol for rumpkernels and added UEFI support.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description:
• Worked on the data collector for ‘Faultline’. ‘Faultline’ uses graph theory to simulate attack paths over millions of nodes and relationships inferred from an environment. Worked on the collector module which fetched information of the environment Active Directory. 
 • Wrote the ‘vmagent’. ‘vmagent’ runs on the windows decoys setup in an environment and uses ’ETW’ to detect lateral movement techniques like RDP, PSEXEC, WMI, etc. 
 • Wrote the ‘ransomware’ module for the EDR agent called ‘Landmine’. This module detects if a ransomware is running on an endpoint.

work.title: Technology Consultant - Cloud Applications Developer
work.description:
• Developed cloud based compensation management tools. 
 • Used SAP ERP and Webi to develop real-time dashboards. 
 • Supported various software development initiatives as a member of the Cloud Applications team.
